semantic_title: Coding Guidelines for Underdose of Insulin Due to Insulin Pump Failure
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 4. Chapter 4: Endocrine, Nutritional, and Metabolic Diseases > a. Diabetes mellitus > 5) Complications due to insulin pump malfunction > (a) Underdose of insulin due to insulin pump failure

content.full_text: An underdose of insulin due to an insulin pump failure should be assigned to a code from subcategory T85.6, Mechanical complication of other specified internal and external prosthetic devices, implants and grafts, that specifies the type of pump malfunction, as the principal or first-listed code, followed by code T38.3X6-, Underdosing of insulin and oral hypoglycemic [antidiabetic] drugs. Additional codes for the type of diabetes mellitus and any associated complications due to the underdosing should also be assigned. (Evidence: pg no: 41, L54-L61)
content.summary: Coding sequence for insulin pump failure causing underdose: T85.6- first, then T38.3X6-, plus diabetes and complication codes (Evidence: pg no: 41, L54-L61)
key_concepts: T85.6- code first for pump mechanical complication (Evidence: pg no: 41, L55-L59)
T38.3X6- code second for underdosing (Evidence: pg no: 41, L59-L60)
Add diabetes type and complication codes (Evidence: pg no: 41, L60-L61)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Assign T85.6- as principal or first-listed code (Evidence: pg no: 41, L55-L59)
detailed_rules.explanation: For insulin underdose due to pump failure, assign a code from subcategory T85.6 that specifies the type of pump malfunction as the principal or first-listed code (Evidence: pg no: 41, L55-L59)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Follow with T38.3X6- for underdosing (Evidence: pg no: 41, L59-L60)
detailed_rules.explanation: After the pump malfunction code, assign T38.3X6- for underdosing of insulin and oral hypoglycemic antidiabetic drugs (Evidence: pg no: 41, L59-L60)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Add diabetes type and complication codes (Evidence: pg no: 41, L60-L61)
detailed_rules.explanation: Additional codes for the type of diabetes mellitus and any associated complications due to the underdosing should also be assigned (Evidence: pg no: 41, L60-L61)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify insulin pump failure causing underdose
Step 2: Assign T85.6- code for specific pump malfunction as principal/first-listed
Step 3: Assign T38.3X6- for underdosing as secondary code
Step 5: Add any complication codes due to underdosing

code_ranges.description: Mechanical complication of other specified internal and external prosthetic devices, implants and grafts (Evidence: pg no: 41, L55-L56)
code_ranges.requirement: Principal or first-listed code for pump malfunction
usage_rules: Specify type of pump malfunction (Evidence: pg no: 41, L58-L59)
Use as principal or first-listed code (Evidence: pg no: 41, L59)

code_ranges.description: Underdosing of insulin and oral hypoglycemic [antidiabetic] drugs (Evidence: pg no: 41, L59-L60)
usage_rules: Follow T85.6- code (Evidence: pg no: 41, L59-L60)

code_categories_mentioned: Diabetes mellitus codes for underlying condition

coding_scenarios.scenario: Insulin pump mechanical failure causing underdose and hyperglycemia
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Patient with Type 1 diabetes presents with hyperglycemia due to insulin pump mechanical failure resulting in underdose of insulin
step_by_step: Step 2: Assign T85.614A as principal code
Step 4: Assign E10.65 for Type 1 diabetes with hyperglycemia
Step 5: Consider additional complication codes if applicable

correct_coding.sequencing: Pump failure first, underdosing second, diabetes third
correct_coding.rationale: Mechanical complication is principal cause, followed by underdosing effect and underlying diabetes (Evidence: pg no: 41, L55-L61)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Should sequence pump failure first as principal diagnosis

breakdown.T85.614A: Breakdown of insulin pump, initial encounter (Evidence: pg no: 41, L55-L59)
breakdown.T38.3X6A: Underdosing of insulin, initial encounter (Evidence: pg no: 41, L59-L60)
breakdown.E10.65: Type 1 diabetes with hyperglycemia (Evidence: pg no: 41, L60-L61)

examples.rationale: Proper sequencing with mechanical complication first (Evidence: pg no: 41, L55-L61)

warnings: T85.6- must be principal or first-listed code (Evidence: pg no: 41, L59)
Must include both pump failure and underdosing codes (Evidence: pg no: 41, L55-L60)
best_practices: Specify exact type of pump malfunction (Evidence: pg no: 41, L58-L59)
Include all complications from underdosing (Evidence: pg no: 41, L60-L61)
tips: Mechanical complication takes precedence in sequencing (Evidence: pg no: 41, L59)
Consider all effects of insulin underdose (Evidence: pg no: 41, L60-L61)
implementation_notes: Requires identification of specific pump malfunction type
clinical_context: Insulin pumps can have various mechanical failures
Underdosing can lead to hyperglycemia and other complications
